main event: A circular object was detected by radar close to the ground in Glen Spry, New York on June 27, 1961, with a speed estimated at 700 mph, but there were no visual sightings.
interesting points: The object flashed on and off the radar scope, indicating intermittent visibility., The object was observed for approximately 5 minutes., The sighting was categorized as ground-radar observation., Possible explanations included a malfunction of the radar or interference with no further details provided., There was a subsequent report in which an individual described a bright yellow object moving silently in the sky on July 8, 1961.
witness description: The document suggests there may have been additional witnesses, but specific details are redacted.
